publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens und Eritreas: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / Beta maṣāḥǝft

supportDesc.foliation: There is foliation provided in the bottom of each folio

layout.ab: Primary pricks are visible, horizontal pricks are visible.
The upper line is written above the ruling, the lower line is written above the ruling.

handNote.seg: The name (and other holy names), the first two lines of the explicit of each narrations, the first lines of each stanza, and all the captions of the miniatures are rubricated.

decoDesc.summary: The manuscript is richly decorated with 74 miniatures that belong to the so-called First Gondarine style of decoration. Paintings in the manuscript are mainly of two types on the basis of their appearnce: the first miniatures are introductory images related to the Virgin and other images related to the life of Christ and other Saints. The second and the most centeral miniatures in the manuscript are those that correspond to the thirty-two narrations.

decoNote.desc: A miniature of the art theme with two episodes, showing: first and feeling sad for not having a child, and second, an announcing to them that their prayer is received by God and telling them they will have a daughter soon.
A miniature of the art theme with two episodes, showing: first and , the later carrying a child, both going to the temple, and second, the child being blessed by two priests in the temple.
A miniature of the art theme with one episode showing from the infancy of Mary in which she is fed in the Temple by an .

A miniature of the art theme with two episodes showing: first, the , named , in the aspect of an old man, informing the Virgin , who is portrayed in the act of spinning, that she will become the mother of Jesus.
A miniature of the art theme with one episode showing saluting , surrounded by other relatives.

A miniature of the art theme with episodes, showing: first sitting near to the child who is lying on a garment manger, and second, a cow and donkey breathing on the child giving Him heat with , and other three angels surrounded in the depiction.
A miniature of the art theme with one episode showing the infanticide ordered by , sitting on a throne and his soldiers slaughtering the children.
A miniature of the art theme with one episode showing, who is carrying her child mounted on donkey and and standing before and after them respectively.

A miniature of the art theme with two episodes, showing: first, Satan in the aspect of an elderly man appearing to and trying to tempt him, and second, Satan with his real demonized image flying far from who is performing a gesture of blessing.

A miniature of the art theme with two episodes, showing: first, standing and praying near to the river Jordan, and second, baptizing in the river Jordan. The is in the form of a dove descending from above.
A miniature with two episodes, showing: first, Saint who is reaching her two hands praying at Golgotha over a tomb which is surrounded by keepers; and second, the apparition of Our Lord to Mary.
A miniature with one episode showing a group of angels and prophets surrounding bowing for the glorification of the Virgin Saint who is standing with her hands crossed on her chest.
A miniature with one episode showing providing hopes to his mother who is sitting near to the him, surrounded by angels, saints, prophets and David (playing his baganā).
A miniature with one episode where our Lord is showing hell to and the depiction is surrounded by angels.
A miniature showing Saint in Qarānǝyo with two episodes: first grieving about sinners and second who is standing with stretched hands praying about the sinners.
A miniature of the art theme with one episode where Our Lord and His mother Saint standing in the center of the scene and surrounded by angels.
A miniature of the art theme with one episode where the Virgin is depicted asleep in the center of the scene and surrounded by apostles with some handling lights.
A miniature of the art theme with one episode where is standing with her hands crossed on her chest, surrounded by angels on clouds.

A miniature with one episode showing a group of people with traditional Ethiopian musical instruments surrounding and playing music for the glorification of the Virgin Saint who is sitting in the center of the depiction.
The iconography of the art theme showing the icon and the angles and depicted left and right respectively.
A miniature with one episode, showing the Lord depicted with His mother and teaching the twelve who are surrounding the scene.

A miniature of the art theme with four episodes, showing: first who is sitting on a throne and giving the book of the to who is sitting near to him on a throne; second, receiving a gift of vestment and throne from ; third, 's successor who is sitting on a throne reads the and fourth, the successor bishop falling and being smitten by for having touched 's gifts to without permission.
A miniature of the art theme with two episodes, showing: first, the peasant standing and praying near to the icon and second, who is carrying her Child, in the same depiction blessing the peasant.

A miniature illustrating with four episodes, showing: first, the Jewish priest with crossed hands praying in front of who is sitting on a throne with the two deacons in the background; second, the Jewish priest lying on the ground after his fall from excess bowing and third, raising the Jewish priest by her hand.

A miniature of the art theme with of two episodes, showing: first, Dǝmyānos writing the name of in a manuscript and second, Dǝmyānos lying down before the icon of Mary, performing a gesture of blessing (in the background, the pillar of gold, on which inscribed Dǝmyānos' name is depicted).

A miniature of the art theme with three episodes, showing: first, the bishop ʾAbbās standing and distributing holy communion surrounded by the faithful, among whom is the woman who kisses his hand; second, the bishop sitting and cutting off his hand, and third, the bishop and the faithful standing in front of the icon of the , which has healed his hand.
A miniature of the art theme with two episodes showing: first, the monk Yǝsḥaq falling on the ground during the apparition of Mary, and second, the icon of taking Yǝsḥaq by the hand and raising him.
A miniature of the art theme with one episode, showing: standing next to Māryām of Dafrā where the house represented with Jerusalem is depicted near to her.

A miniature of the art theme with three episodes, showing: first, the painter sitting on a scaffold and drawing a scene; second, the painter falling down from the scaffold and third, the icon of extending her hand to save the painter.

A miniature of the art theme with four episodes, showing, first, two men carrying the sick pilgrim on bed; second the sick pilgrim standing before the places to which carries him; third, Golgotha, Jerusalem, the mount of Olives, Bethlehem and the Jordan are depicted; and fourth, is standing in the middle of the places depicted with a house scene background.

A miniature of the art theme with five episodes, showing: first, Zakārǝyās praying the greeting of the angel before the icon of ; second, Zakārǝyās nailing down in front of the icon of ; third, Zakārǝyās decorating Saint Mary's crown in the icon of with roses; fourth, who is sitting on a throne surrounded by angels and the five virgins (carrying roses) and collects roses out of his mouth and fifth, the thieves being consecrated as monks.

A miniature of the art theme with two episodes, showing: first, the two thieves attempting to eat the bread they stole from Yolyānā and Barbārā and second, the two thieves standing before an icon of being consecrated as monks.

A miniature of the art theme with six episodes, showing: first, the three Arabs swimming in the water; second, one man being eaten by a crocodile; third, the two others standing on a rock above the water; fourth, one man riding a camel to the monastery, which is depicted in the background; fifth, the other man bringing his sheep's wool and sixth, the camel brought by the Arab eating from a tree.

A miniature of the art theme with three episodes, showing: first, surrounded by the sleeping monks of the monastery, which is depicted in the background; second, the monastery with its monks that has been moved to the shore of the see and third, a group of people marvelling at the miracle.

A miniature of the art theme with two episodes, showing: first, the priest Yoḥannǝs is depicted standing and praying before the icon of the Virgin and Child and second, taking out her breast and dropping her milk into the eyes of Yoḥannǝs.

A miniature of the art theme with four episodes, showing: first, the rich man from Qʷalāsis travelling with his companions on a ship; second, three individuals from Qʷǝz piercing the eye of the nobleman; third, the rich man fallen after his eye has been pierced by arrows from the enemies and fourth, the rich man standing next to a small statue of himself in front of the icon of the .

A miniature of the art theme with four episodes, showing: first, the woman and her blind daughter standing and praying before the icon of the ; second, both lying asleep before the icon of ; third waking up the girl, and fourth, giving sight to the blind girl by dropping her breast's milk.

A miniature of the art theme with three episodes, showing: first, the poor widow praying before the icon of the where her three daughters are sitting below her; second, the funeral of the eldest daughter, who is wrapped in a shroud and surrounded by persons, and third, the two other daughters standing next to the arborist man called Tewos.
A miniature of the art theme with two episodes, showing: first, lying in prison bound at his hands and feet, with a dove appearing to him; second, standing healed from his wounds.

A miniature of the art theme with three episodes, showing: first, the custodian of the church standing in front of the sitting Kaṭir ordering him to leave the church; second, sitting on a throne surrounded by two angels with the custodian of the church sitting before her; third, the healed Kaṭir standing before , who is sitting on throne.

A miniature of the art theme with seven episodes, showing: first, the two brothers and the Muslim customer gathered around a piece of cloth; second, the Muslim holding the cloth of Nazib with an interest to kiss him for preparing him cloths; third, the Muslim denouncing Nazib to the judge; fourth, Nazib lying in prison bound at his hands and feet; fifth, riding on a horse, brandishing a weapon, and appearing to the judge; sixth, the judge handing to Nazib his paper of release; and seventh, Nazib entering the church, in which the people are gathered, and handing his paper of release to the priest.

A miniature of the art theme with three episodes/events, showing: first, the bishop sitting on a throne before the people, who are gathered in a church, and amongst whom is the man with the petrified foot; second, the man with the petrified foot standing and praying before an icon of the while his foot is healed; third, the man showing his healed foot to the bishop with the people standing in the background.

A miniature of the art theme with seven episodes, showing: first, the leprous bishop Marqorewos standing before Patriarch Zakārǝyās and showing him his leprosy; second, the patriarch warning Marqorewos not to deliver liturgical service; third, Marqorewos praying before the icon of the ; fourth, healing the leprous bishop and performing gesture of blessing; fifth, the bishop showing himself healed to patriarch Zakārǝyās; sixth, the bishop showing himself healed to his student; and seventh, the healed bishop distributing the Eucharist.

A miniature of the art theme with four episodes, showing: first, two men carrying the woman with a broken foot on a stretcher; second, the woman lying below the icon of the ; third, the broken foot woman again lying below the icon of on another episode; fourth, the custodian looking the broken woman who is standing near to him with the icon of depicted from the other side.

A miniature of the art theme with seven episodes, showing: first, Sofǝyā lying on top of a building before the icon of the and ordering an to take the child from Sofǝyā's womb; second, an carries away the child from Sofǝyā's womb; third, the giving the child to Finkǝs to adopt him; fourth, the bishop sitting on a throne in front of a group of women accusing Sofǝyā; fifth, the bishop and Sofǝyā sitting next to each other discussing about the manner of the pregnancy; sixth, the bishop receiving the child from the hands of Finkǝs, sitting near to the bishop; and seventh, Sofǝyā's Child, who later become successor of the former bishop (died some time before), surrounded by three persons.

A miniature of the art theme with seven episodes, showing: first, Bārok giving wine in a vessel to his servant to distribute it to the guests; second, his guests sitting and drinking wine; third, the gusts eating food in Bārok's house; fourth; Bārok's enemies attacking him holding several weapons; fifth, a depiction of the icon of the ; sixth, Bārok being consecrated as a monk; seventh, the funeral of Bārok.

A miniature of the art theme with two episodes, showing: first, ʾAnǝsṭāsyos standing and praying in a church where the icon of the depicted in front of him; second, ʾAnǝsṭāsyos lying before the icon of , who is extending her hand towards him and announcing him good news concerning his illness.

A miniature of the art theme with four episodes, showing: first, the monk Sālusi surrounded by other monks, who are attacking him; second, the monks preventing him to eat; third, the monk Sālusi standing and praying in a church before the icon of the and fourth, the monk Sālusi stood up near to the Church after penetrating the wall of the Church with his skull-cap fallen to the ground.

A miniature of the art theme with seven episodes, showing: first, the cannibal surrounded by the bodies of those he killed; ; second, peasants and other inhabitants fleeing from the cannibal, with several houses depicted in the background; third, the cannibal offering water to a beggar covered by sores of leprosy; fourth, , sitting on a throne ordering the demons to add the soul of the cannibal to the hell and the demons holding the soul of the cannibal; fifth; two weighing the cannibal's good and bad deeds in a scale; sixth, requesting her beloved Son to give mercy for the soul of the cannibal, and seventh, holding the soul of the cannibal.

A miniature of the art theme with four episodes, showing: first, the widow's son stealing cloth from a church; second, the thief being hanged by the people; third, ordering the punishers to let him free, and fourth, the thief standing in front of the icon of the who is depicted on a throne.

A miniature of the art theme with three episodes, showing: first, the woman holding her new-born child protected by from the wave; second a church amongst the waves from which the people are fleeing, and third, the woman with her child surrounded by the marvelling people.

A miniature of the art theme with three episodes, showing: first, the thirsty dog searching for water and being kicked by one of the two women sitting near to the well surrounded by plants; second, giving the dog water to drink from her shoe and, third, the group of virgins who chase out the dog gathered around the well.
A miniature of the art theme showing: the triumphal entry of (mounting on donkey during the Palm Sunday) into the city of Jerusalem with on a welcoming crowd.
A Miniature of the art theme with one episode, showing: washing 's feet.
A Miniature of the with one episode, showing: the Lord sorrounded by the presenting the Eucharist in the form of a sheep

A minitaure of the art theme with one episode showing: in the Garden of Gethsemane and on the top margin an carrying a cross and giving it to and , and PRS11937Yaqob all depicted in the form of sadness.
A Miniature of the art theme with one episode, showing: crowned with thorns and bieng striked at His head by two Jews who hold hammers from His right and left directions.

A Miniature of the art theme with two episodes from bottom to top, showing: first, he , and who are in the act sadness are preceded by who is carrying a wood and second, the jews crucifying on a cross with two angels collecting blood drope from His body.
A Miniature of the art theme showing and Nicodemus burrying with and other relatives depicted in the act of sad.
A Miniature of the art theme with one episode showing saving and and both from the bottom holding His grament from right and left directions.
A Miniature of the art theme with one episode showing in the act of ascension and and depicted from two directions.
A Miniature of the art theme with one episode showing bieng sliced and behaded by his opponents.
A Miniature of the art theme with one episode showing tongues of fire appearing above Saint and the .
A Miniature of the art theme showing showing (though not named in the captions) who mounted on white hourse, attcking a dragon to save a girl named Birutāwit.
A Miniature of the art theme showing the martyr mounting on a white hourse.

A minature of the art theme with one episode, showing, the Second Coming of who is depicted in the center where an image of sinners on the left side and an image of those to be saved at the right. On the top margin the scene is sorrounded by angels sand on the bottom side the demonized devil depicted with dark color.

A Miniature of the art theme with multiple episode of sorrow depictions in relation to the martyr , first showing a King ordering his solders to to add into sloughtering and heating where some techniques and tools of assassination are used in one step after the other, second,the opponents arresting on a tree, third; they add him alive into a fired metal bed, fourth; they add his powdered flesh in to a wind and fourth, the Almighty God giving him the streangth and standing near his God, fifth; the opponents on another part removing his teeth with pincer, sixth; they add him alive into a metal dish of sharp components, and seventh; they heat his body over a heating tool eighth; they separate his body with other asharp tool and ninth, they ropped his mouth and beheaded him.
A Miniature of the art theme showing a group of jews stonning Saint the martyr to death.
A minature showing Saint and the mother of and the child in particular stands near to a fire in the depiction.
A minature showing the youngsters ʾĀnānǝya, ʾĀzarǝya and Misāʾel who are dropped to a fire by enemies rescued by an .

A minature of the art theme with two episodes, showing: First to the lest side, Saint satnding with his two lions sitting near to him and secnod, Saint and Saint portrayed to the right side of the depiction.
A minature showing Saint who is ropped on a wood and bieng pierced by two men from his left and right side.

item.desc: The name , indicated as the woner of the manuscript his wife as well as his father and his mother have been added later in red ink in spaces left empity in the supplications at the beginning and end of the explicits and incipits.
Short Amharic note concerning land disrtibution and ownership .
This short note addreses that the the manuscript is prepared for and his wife and strongly condemns on those who try to steal the manuscript in the name of Peter and Paul.
item.q: ለዝንቱ፡ መጽሓፍ፡ ዘ፡፡ኪሩቤል ወዘምስለ ፡ ኮለ ገነት ዘፈሐቆ፡ ወዘሰረቆ፡ ወዘተአገሎ፡ በስልጣነ፡ ጴጥሮስ፡ ወጳውሎስ፡ ውጉዘ፡ ከመ፡ አርዮስ ፡ለይኩን።

item.desc: Cotton that are tied directly to the tops of the pages are used to protect each minatuares.

binding.decoNote: Blind-tooled leather cover, with textile inlays
Parchment guards are placed around each quire.

history.origin: The manuscript is dated to by the Art Institute of Chicago, but nothing is indicated concerning the method of their datation. The manuscript can be dated , an inclusive period of categorization of all manuscripts.
history.provenance: Nothing is indicated in the manuscript concerning its spesfic Ethiopian place of origin in the text, but it is indicated in the website of the current holders of the manuscript that the manuscript was sold to the Art Institute of Chicago in 2002 by the institute, Sam Fogg Rare Books and Manuscripts, London.
